instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected but show 0% level
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery is detected but always shows 0% level. Do you you have any suggest?
Second problem is that if I install 2 sticks of ram of 2gb each (2x2gb), macbook detects 1 gb for each slot(2x1gb). Is a ram slot dead? is there a fix for this?

macbook runs only with battery even if it show 0% level

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected but show 0% level
threads.message:
Have you tried a known good battery ?

Is the machine stable with 2 x 2gb ram installed ? You tried known good memory ?

Could be bad RAM slots or MCP. Either way its a no fix.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected but show 0% level
threads.message: both slot work, but every stick ram I install, macbook detects half of the size. no changes if I install in both slot or only one, it's always detected half of the size

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected but show 0% level
threads.message: Must use PC8500. Probably bad battery too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected but show 0% level
threads.message: reflowed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and now works, ram logic board hasn't any problem with ram, I simply received fake garbage ram from Ebay seller
